instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message:
6 months ago customer spilled water on macbook, a week ago he tells me its shutting down sometimes, I ran a stress test and found the cpu was hitting 99c and throttling but I couldnt get it to shut down, I replaced the TIM and the fan, seemed to work, the next day customer says it doing the same thing, I start it it doesnt boot at all, the fan spins twice (sometimes) but doesnt spin a third time. original repair report is attached


-----inspection report----------
no green light
jtag corrosion
corrosion on <CHIP>U8130</CHIP>
corrosion between <CAPACITOR>C7323</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7324</CAPACITOR>
corrosion on <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>
heavy corrosion <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>
corrosion <CHIP>U3510</CHIP>
corrosion <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>
corrosion <CHIP>U1845</CHIP>
corrosion <CHIP>U7840</CHIP>
corrosion <CHIP>U5540</CHIP>
corrosion <CHIP>U5620</CHIP>
--------------dc-in board report---------------
dc-in flex cable corroded, dc-in side
dc-in board corroded around connector
-------------repair report------------------------
jtag removed
200ohms@<CAPACITOR>C7624</CAPACITOR>
ultrasonic-alcohol-oven
no green light
fan spin 1.7 <SIGNAL>S0_CPU</SIGNAL> present
folder icon over thunderbolt
no backlight no display
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 2.2VOLTS
replace dc-in board
------------------AFTER PARTS REPLACEMENT-------------
green light
fan spin
backlight + lcd present

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message: how are the probe points between the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and its termination resistors looking?

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message: I'm also suspecting crap under the SMC.

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message:
@louis test points look fine, none broken, a little dark but in decent condition, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to all surrounding resistors is good
@duke this was repaired and ultrasonicd 6 months ago and worked perfectly since then

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message: Yes, 6 months is a nice amount of time for corrosion to get conductive. No U/S treatment will remove corrosion from under BGA chips!

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message:
ok a reflow of the smc means its not running again, dont know if its still going to randomly shutdown
duke, can you please tell me how you came up with the smc so i can learn from this

threads.title: 2014 macbook air, turning off randomly, now not turning on at att
threads.message: Experience is all. Any time there is corrosion anywhere near the SMC you can bet your ass it got under it too.
